ovdesc.p: This file contains Basic data and Parameter fields required for Bill contract processing. There is only one record as "SYSTEM" is maintained and which has all basic details
which includes Transaction code for various activity, Accrual frequency, P&L category code for Interest Received Advance, grace days etc.
These fields will be used to default the values in BL module when the values are not defined in BGC or BTTC.
Record in this file is essential before inputting Bill contract or any other BL module static file.

This is an optional field. If it is decided that the Commission charged should be a on periodic basis and if we define that the value as NULL, the commission will be charged on a non calendar basis and if it is YES, the commission will be on a Calendar based.
Calendar comprises of 4 quarters viz. Jan to Mar, Apr to June, July to Sept, Oct to Dec.
For example
In April, when a BL Contract is back value dated to March, and it was decided to charge on a periodic basis.

If we define that the Commission should be charged on a non calendar Basis, (leaving the Calendar Based field as NULL), the commission will be charged from March to May as a block and June to August as another block.

However, if we define the Commission to be charged as Calendar Based, (filling the Calendar Based field as YES), the starting block will be taken as Jan to March, since the value date falls in that block and it will charge for two Blocks, one for Jan to Mar and another for Apr to Jun.

BL.MESSAGE.CLASS and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS are used to formulate the class mapping between Bill Internal Class and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS.

The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS has lend itself to facilitate the user by automatically trigger only the message related to the operation, which user are currently do. In a sense, the system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to corresponding activity, and populate the information on the Bill transaction. Consequently, the user can take control of the class to choose whether he/she wants to produce as per suggestion by the system.
The following types are valid types:
+AMEND.ADD
+AMEND.REMOVE
+ USER.DEFINE1
+ USER.DEFINE2
..... + USERDEFINE10
For more detail, please refer T24 Users Guide.

Defines the number of days a client has to settle a Bill repayment before penalty interest is charged.

This field defines the number of days, after a repayment date, that a client has in which to settle the balance on his Bill account. At the end of this period a penalty will be charged based on the outstanding debit balance on the Bill account.

Penalty charges are calculated by applying a percentage rate to any debit balance on the Bill account. The calculation and application of the penalty is made on a monthly basis on the day determined by this field.

This is an Optional Field with the Format nnC or nnW where nn is a number from 1 to 99."C" for calendar days and "W" working days. An input of 0 is also allowed. If no value is entered, then the value would default as per the defaulting mechanism.
1 - 2 numeric characters. (Optional input)
Must be numeric suffixed with "C" or "W"

In a discounted contract, the Discounted interest amortisation frequency is defined in this field.
The user has the choice of either Daily or Monthly or Week accruals and the following examples define the various options:-
(i) 12 DEC 2001 D - this input specifies that the first interest accrual shall be on 12th Dec 2001 and thereafter interest accruals shall be at daily (D) intervals.

(ii) 31 JAN 2001 M0131 - this input specifies that the first interest accrual shall be on 31st Jan 2001 and thereafter interest accruals shall be at monthly (M01) intervals on the last day (31) of each month.
(iii) 31 JAN 2001 M0115 - this input specifies that the first interest accrual shall be on 31st Jan 2001 and thereafter at monthly (01) intervals on the fifteenth day (15) of each month.

This field is updated automatically whenever the accrual process has taken place and so unless the accrual cycle is to be changed, the only time attention needs to be paid to this field is at installation. Prior to the first 'off-line' of the system, the date entered here must be equal or greater than the 'NEXT RUN DATE' field in the appropriate BL BATCH job. If it is greater than the date specified on the batch record then the update of the batch job NEXT RUN DATE must coincide with the date entered here at some point in the future.
Daily or Monthly or Week
